title: Scientists search for new methods to cure neurodegenerative diseases

title_detail.value: Scientists search for new methods to cure neurodegenerative diseases

summary: Most neurons in the human brain are generated from neural stem cells during embryonic development. After birth, a small reservoir of stem cells remains in the brain that keeps on producing new neurons throughout life. However, the question arises as to whether these new neurons really support brain function? And if so, can we improve brain capacity by increasing the number of neurons? A research group has now answered these questions.
